checkItemAcceptance

public boolean checkItemAcceptance(S source,
                                   T target,
                                   java.util.Collection<E> dndElements)
Description copied from interface: IDnDBehavior
Triggered to check if the target would accept the drop.

Specified by:
checkItemAcceptance in interface IDnDBehavior<E extends IDnDElement,S extends IDnDSource<? extends E>,T extends IDnDTarget>
Parameters:
source - : the dnd Source object from which the DnDElements are originated
target - : the dnd Target object containing the drop location.
dndElements - : Collection of the dragged DnDElements
Returns:
true if the drop should be accepted, false otherwise. Usually, it triggers a change in the "avatar" appearance

onDrop

public boolean onDrop(java.util.Collection<E> dndElements,
                      S source,
                      T target,
                      java.lang.String targetNodeId,
                      boolean isCopy)
Description copied from interface: IDnDBehavior
Triggered when one or more dnd elements are dropped on a target. This is where you should implement your DOM modification after the drop. (Maybe moving a widget from one place to another ...)

Specified by:
onDrop in interface IDnDBehavior<E extends IDnDElement,S extends IDnDSource<? extends E>,T extends IDnDTarget>
Parameters:
dndElements - : Collection of the dropped DnDElements
source - : the dnd Source object from which the DnDElements are originated
target - : the dnd Target object containing the drop location.
targetNodeId - : Id of the DOM element on which we drop, inside the dnd target (can be null, or anything).
isCopy - : wether the nodes should be copied or moved. This flag is usually set up by the user pressing "Ctrl" key while dragging.
Returns:
: true if the drop has been accepted, false otherwise
